response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Value> it = values.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
v = it.next();
x = v.index1;
if (it.hasNext()) {
y = it.next().index1;
} else {
y = v;
}
System.out.println(x);
System.out.println(y);
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're using the same iterator object for both next() calls. Instead, you should use a separate iterator object for the second next() call.
